description: [Leadership] The passing of Professor Frank Nwachukwu Ndili, Nigeria's first Nuclear Physicist and Africa's first Professor in the field, is a moment of both sorrow and gratitude. His life was one of glory, excellence, and exemplary achievements. As a beloved husband, father, grandfather, great-grandfather, and patriarch, he left an indelible mark on those who knew him.
title: Africa: Ndili, Africa's First Professor of Nuclear Physics, Bows Out

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- KCB seeks to grow remittances within the East African region after signing a deal between KCB and Mastercard.
title: Africa: Kcb, Mastercard Join Hands to Grow Remittances Within East Africa

description: [MSF] Over the last two years, countries' ministries of health and organisations like Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) have been trying to respond to a string of cholera outbreaks around the world. Why are we seeing so many outbreaks? What's causing them? And do we have the tools and resources needed to respond to them? MSF's International Medical Coordinator Dr Daniela Garone explains in this interview.
title: Africa: Responding to Cholera Is a Multipronged Approach

description: [ISS] The timing of last week's ICJ hearings could lead to greater compliance with the court's ruling than in previous cases.
title: Africa: African Countries Join a United Front Against Israeli Occupation

description: [New Times] Rwanda will host the International Vaccine Institute's (IVI) Africa regional office, due to open in 2024, the Seoul-based organisation said on Tuesday, February 27.
title: Africa: Rwanda to Host Africa Global Vaccine Institute Office

description: [UNFPA] Mogadishu, Somalia -- "I used to feel fear when it was night time," mother-of-two Nurto Abdi Osman told UNFPA, the United Nations sexual and reproductive health agency.
title: Africa: Somali Survivors of Female Genital Mutilation Advocate to Change Minds - and Lives

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Azimio leader Raila Odinga says he is entirely grateful to President William Ruto for endorsing his candidature for the African Union Commission Chairmanship.
title: Africa: Odinga Thanks Ruto, Museveni for Endorsing His AU Commission Chairmanship Bid

description: [Nile Post] A South Sudan minister has set out to eliminate 'ghost workers' from public payroll and vowed not to pay out a mountain of claims worth millions of dollars until the invoices are verified.
title: Africa: South Sudan's New Finance Minister Braving 'Ghosts' and Crocodiles

description: [Shabelle] Mogadishu, Somalia -- The Somali Army chief, Ibrahim Sheikh, met with AU military officials to discuss ways to speed up the ongoing all-out war on Al-Shabaab militants.
title: Africa: Somali Army Chief Meets AU Military Officials On War Against Al-Shabaab

description: [Reporter] Still reeling from the effects of COVID-19 and the Ukraine war, African countries face yet another geopolitical hurdle with the Red Sea crisis and its potentially significant economic ramifications.
title: Africa: Impact of Red Sea Crisis On Africa - Red Flag or Red Herring?

description: [Reporter] Even during difficult circumstances, we all want the best for our children no matter what age they are and what situation they are in. As a parent, the first thing I wish for my son is for him to be healthy and happy, and I can assure you that every parent feels the same way.
title: East Africa: Leaving No One Behind - Reaching Every Child in Humanitarian Settings in the Horn of Africa

description: [The Herald] LILONGWE, Malawi -- African nations must assist Zimbabwe to ensure the unfair sanctions imposed by the West are removed, the African Union Southern Africa Regional Office Ambassador, David Claude Pierre, has said.
title: Africa: African Diplomats Want Sanctions to Go

description: [The Herald] Zambia's kwacha has emerged as the top-performing African currency against the US dollar this year, boosted by the central bank's aggressive monetary policy tightening.
title: Africa: Kwacha Africa's Best Performing Currency in 2024

description: [IPS] Bangkok, Thailand -- 2023 was the warmest year on record. The latest Copernicus Climate Change Service highlights that February 2023 to January 2024 was the first time that we experienced 12 consecutive months of temperatures 1.5-degree hotter than the pre-industrial era.
title: Africa: Unpacking 2023, the Warmest Year On Record
